newsitem.title: POLAND: Rumeli ups stake in Polish cement plant.
newsitem.headline: Rumeli ups stake in Polish cement plant.

text.p: Turkey's Rumeli concern has finalised a 1996 agreement to buy a 33 percent stake in the Polish Cementownia Nowa Huta SA cement plant and has bought back shares from the firm's employees, Rumeli said on Friday.

By the end of the month Rumeli will also finalise an already agreed purchase of 27 percent of Nowa Huta for $21 million from 14 National Investment funds which have 1.9 percent of the cement plant each, Rumeli said in a statement.

In July last year Rumeli agreed to pay $20 million for 33 percent of Nowa Huta held by National Investment Fund No. 4 but had to wait to finalise the deal for an interior ministry clearance, necessary in all foreign majority takeovers.

The statement said Rumeli has also bought 15 percent of Nowa Huta's stock held by its 446 employees for $9 million. It will raise wages by 15 percent, pay out a one-off bonus of 8,000 zlotys and keep the company's jobs for five years.
Nowa Huta has about five percent of the Polish cement market. Rumeli said it planned to raise Nowa Huta's output to one million tonnes of cement a year from the current 600,000 tonnes.

Engin Saydam, Rumeli's representative in Poland said in the statement the higher output would be possible thanks to a modernisation of the plant in which Rumeli wants to invest $58 million over the next five years.
"We have already made a modernisation plan and picked the company whcih will do it. The work will begin in February," he said.
Nowa Huta had a net profit of 2.3 million zlotys in 1995 on sales of 40.6 million zlotys, down from 7.7 million and 55.3 million zlotys respectively in 1994.
